column4: I have an issue with xorg that I can't seem to solve. First, I have no xorg.conf file anywhere on my system, and when I try to run xorg -configure I get told to basically go fish. Can someone please help me?
run: Xorg --configure    in a root recovery console, should be fine
then try websearching what is said..
you can use this guide to make the boot use the framebuffer driver: http://www.namanb.com/2010/05/changing-bootup-resolution-plymouth-in-ubuntu-10-04-lucid-lynx.html
hold shift at boot, then select recovery mode, then select root
it  is, scroll down off the bottom of the menu
both will be available in natty but unity will be default, natty is discussed and supported in #ubuntu+1
add ppa then refresh packages, you can then install it like any other package
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:stebbins/handbrake-releases; sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install handbrake
what is the output of:  lsb_release -sc
there is nothing to 'click' you need the command I ave
all you have to do is copy and paste the command I gave and it will install the app...
no idea where you go the idea you click something
can you give a pastebin of the output please
then run:  sudo apt-get install handbrake-cli
